title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Very thoughtful process to identify the right candidate. Mixed bag of easy and tough questions. Evenly paced to gather your thoughts to respond. Be prepared for loads of examples from past 5 years.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, with a focus in the past 5 years

title: Learning And Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: They had a multi prong approach to their interview process. A screening, an interview and a practical exercise to be submitted 72hours later. Great feedback and a top candidate but went to someone else.
Interview Questions: What do you need from a manager to be successful?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview was around twenty minutes. You will interview with people in your team. Everyone was very nice and friendly, the interview will be fine as long as you prepare for it.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: COOP Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviewers taking turn asking questions. There were a mix of behavioural and traditional questions. They were all friendly and make me feel comfortable. The interview lasted about one hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult decision you had to make.

title: Annual Giving Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interviewers. A few critical questions asked. I got the job and worked there for a few months. Sr Manager was always very supportive, but some of the managers were powertripping all the time.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge you faced and how did you overcome it?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Very professional interview process. One screener, followed by an in person with an in basket take home assessment followed by another in person interview. Organized and structured interviews with clear communication.
Interview Questions: Describe an interpersonal conflict at work and how you resolved it.

title: Career Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: started with get to know you call and explain interest in the role, followed by at least three interviews, two with a panel of interviewers and a short presentation. Do your preparation.
Interview Questions: Examples of where you had to adapt to a new strategy?

title: Economic Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a research analyst position with the economics department at UBC. I completed a take home test in Stata and had an in-person interview with the professor. He verbally stated that I had the job and we shook hands on it. He mentioned that he would send across the formal offer letter. I heard from him 4 months later asking if I was still interested in the position. I recommend avoiding like the plague.
Interview Questions: Data wrangling and coding related questions. Statistical and econometric questions and questions on my prior experience.

title: Technical Support Analyst - Co-op Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview was via Zoom with manager and team lead. Manager asks personality/ customer service questions; team lead asks technical questions. After the interview, an one-hour written assessment is given to see what will you do given certain client situations.
Interview Questions: What is a router and how does it work.

title: Associate international student advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I Interviewed with three people in the team. One hour interview and in basket questions. I had some scenario questions and behavioral questions. I have not heard back yet, still waiting.
Interview Questions: Describe the experience you answer the same questions

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Good experience, recruiter reached out quickly, and interview was scheduled fairly quickly as well. People interviewing creating a nice atmosphere and were very cordial. I can recommend the process and would do it again even though I was not offered a job..
Interview Questions: Standard Interview questions were asked.

title: Marketing Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: It was a Zoom panel interview and also consisted on having to present a marketing plan for one of their existing events (which was occurring soon). I did not have a good feeling about this going into the interview, because it felt opportunistic.
Interview Questions: What is your supervisory experience?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Very organized but long. It takes time before they get back to you which is disheartening but the people are so nice. They are approachable and open to questions. Overall the process is great
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and experience

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Usually 2 person panel will conduct interviews. Mainly situational questions and specific questions about your experience and skills. Nothing too complicated. People made me feel welcome and at ease in the interview
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize in specific situations?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: first applied online then got an interview for a chat where they asked easy behavioural questions then a meeting with the supervision professor. Next a few questions about grades and past experience with programming languages and then an overview of the position.
Interview Questions: why did i decide to pursue a degree in stats?

title: FINACIAL ADVISOR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The position was a temporary hiring solution. Firstly applied on their portal, then had 5 assessments and a recorded video interview. For the assesements, we had to score pre-defined marks, for which I couldn't.
Interview Questions: Q. Example of meeting tight deadline?

title: Learning Technology Rover Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
One 19 min interview through video chat, first a description of the role, then mostly questions on soft skills and situations rather than technical skills. 

Interview was very cordial and friendly.
Interview Questions: What is active listening?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Just talked directly with the prof to show your understanding about the knowledge of the course. The process is very friendly. You just have a chat with the prof. There is no need to worry too much about it.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about SQL, what is your interest.

title: Change Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Slightly more intensive interview process including prescreen by HR, and two additional interviews. Longer time periods between interviews made the entire application process quite long. Communication was not always prompt.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions including those that referred to previous experience, education and scenario based type questions.

title: Masters Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and generally the professor wants to know about who you are and why you want to do their research. I was surprised about how much he was asking me and how I really did not need to research his entire work.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with mice?

title: Kitchen Helper Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Just one sit-down interview. They book an interview time to meet and then you just meet them at the spot and do the deed and get that bread; One on One meeting no gangups.
Interview Questions: Why you want the job. What kind of work are you looking for in the kitchen. What past experience you have.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Talked to a professor I had a high level course with. No formal interview. It was based on whether your skills align with their research needs. The professor was already familiar with the quality of my work.
Interview Questions: Are you able to help in (insert specific task)? What experience do you have in (research task)?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Virtual Interview- The candidate has to answer a few questions and the interview is recorded. Online Technical Test- Test to check aptitude in MS Office and typing speed. Live online interview- To discuss more on past roles and experiences. Reference Check- From past employees
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself with UBC in the future?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was automated and by video. It was a strange experience to not speak with a person. After that, it was a group interview, with a three member panel. They were friendly and the interview went well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Student web dev Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: 15 min chat, tell me about yourself, then went in and reviewed the resume in detail, was told later I was not a good fit for this position due to too much hardware/devops experience.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, tell me about your projects, etc

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was over zoom. Felt professional yet casual. There were two rounds to the interview, an initial round and then a round with other lab staff. All in all, very congenial process. Got the job in the end.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you're interested in the position.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Burnaby, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I had a first interview with the hiring manager, a member of the team and the hr, it was a 1 hour interview. Right after the interview the hr sent a test in a word document which I had to complete in 1 hour max. This test had 2 questions on how I would deal with a hypothetical business situation. On the same day I received an email from the hiring manager saying they were impressed by my skills and asked me to provide 3 references, one being from my current manager. I told them that I did not feel comfortable sharing my current manager contact because I did not have an offer from ubc and did not want to compromise my good relationship with my manager. I gave my former managers contact. Hiring manager called all my references. Then disappeared for 1 week, until today, when hr sent me an email saying that another candidate was selected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experiences as a business analyst

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: You will be interviewed by your supervisor and you should expect to introduce yourself professionally and discuss about your past research experience and coursework. There are not many behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The process was very relaxed. The interviewers made it feel less like a questioning/interview and more of a conversation, which was very pleasant. They asked me questions about my own experience and knowledge and what I was interested in.
Interview Questions: What fields and research I was interested in

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fast-paced interview process. (Takes a long time to hear results). Had a fresh interviewer (Never interviewed before) and feel like I did worse on it because of that. But overall the interviewers in both interview (behavioural then technical) were kind and understanding.
Interview Questions: Behaviour questions then Two Sum.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Did reference check with my current manager and hired someone else with more experience, such a joke. Terrible HR / management. Put me in a tough position in my current company because everyone knows I want to quit
Interview Questions: Very basic questions with a written test in the end

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: There is only one round of interview held on zoom The length was about 30 minutes There was only one interviewer Most were behaviour questions and asked about your experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous internship experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Kelowna, BC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online interview. Had to present the work I’ve done in the past that is related to the position. Had a second interview in which I was asked similar questions to the first interview.
Interview Questions: Technical questions related with the subject of interest

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a panel interview held virtually through Zoom. Most of the questions were behavioral/situational questions. There were also questions about your experience and knowledge. All of the interviewers were friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Amazon Web Services?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Strictly technical interview, asked things related to projects done in the master's program and current research interests. Delved deep into the projects and their description and asked what could be done better or differently in various situations.
Interview Questions: Q. Under a different technological constraint, how would the system be designed differently?

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to a video interview with hiring manager and another HR manager. The questions asked were all behavioural questions based on the job description. There was an assignment that took about 45 min to complete - was average difficulty The role ended up going to someone internal.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience handling a difficult hiring manager or employee in a unionized environment?

title: Faclitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Online application open ---Online tasks----Video interview: 1.Self-introduction. 2. Describe your personality. 3. What if questions (conflect situation, how to teamwork with others) 4. How do you see yourself in future 5 years.
Interview Questions: 1.Self-introduction. 2. Describe your personality. 3. What if questions (conflect situation, how to teamwork with others) 4. How do you see yourself in future 5 years.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic standard interview questions. There was no computer testing as part of the pre-hire process. Interview took place virtually due to the restrictions of the pandemic. Was about an hour in length.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you were provided little information to complete a task. How did you handle the situation and were you successful?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: General interview questions via video recording in the first round and then second round over zoom with relevant authority or hiring manager after which they may call you for final round for salary discussion
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, relevant work experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: it was a prerecorded interview, questions were expected to be answered within four minutes, candidates had about sixty seconds to think about the questions before answering. It seemed very difficult because it was my first experience with prerecorded interview, but I learnt something.
Interview Questions: Describe one time you made a mistake and how did you solve the problem.

title: Senior Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Waited for 20 days to hear back and had a Phone interview.  Asked some questions about my experience and the job. The second round is in-person meeting to chat with people in the team
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Moderate and easy level with awareness on outlook with emphasise on financial terms and many important co cepts in finance and mostly excell answers and also on outlook of microsoft
Interview Questions: Tell me about ur self

title: Student IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple process where you were asked some behavioural questions about handling situations and describe about how your skill set would benefit in your student it technician job.
Interview Questions: Q: Do you have an example of where you had to handle conflict resolution

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Receiving Invitation for interview from UBC setting an online meeting via Zoom Join meeting Introducing and speaking about background and achievement and qualification and relevant experience Q&A Talking about responsibilities and expectations
Interview Questions: Asking some questio: Asking about relevant experience Asking about qualifications How to manage a class Recent Transcript How to manage a class Asking about course material Idea about course content

title: Acquatic Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Intense but very supportive and encouraging. Cordial, respectful and allowed time for a response. Punctual, clear and concise instructions. Questions on resume sent earlier to elaborate on experience and outline expectations
Interview Questions: Conflict resolution techniques used past 3 years

title: ISI International Awards Co-op Assistant [F22] Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
1. A 45 minutes zoom interview with three interviewers
2. A 45 minutes in-basket test including tasks like replying to emails, excel vlookup, and word mail merge to create awards document.
Interview Questions: Describe an experience when you have an intercultural conversation with someone who is from another country.

title: ECE Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
sending a resume directly and they reply a week later.
They have a lot of styles of interview they said and I had a group interview(but only 2person there)
1 manager and 3 senior directors there but it depends on the situation.
Interview Questions: What do you think about indigenous?

title: Communications Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: A 20 minute phone conversation with the manager, an hour long panel interview with the team and human resources, and a four hour in-basket assessment which tested your ability to make a project brief.
Interview Questions: What are three qualities that make you a good project manager?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
very smooth process - one round only
The interview was mainly testing candidates' technical and communication skills. 
overall positive experience
school work learn program is very supportive 
great experience interacting with CLC stuff
Interview Questions: walk through a function on Bloomberg

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening first, then in person interview followed by an in basket test. Didn't get a job - I heard they ended up hiring someone who's been working at UBC since the 90s.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral questions: - why do you want to work as an academic advisor - what kind of team player are you - describe how you resolve a challenging task

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom call that first required me to introduce myself and then say why I would be a good fit for the company. I then had to talk about my past positions that were relevant to the role and how those skills were applicable.
Interview Questions: Name your strengths that would help with this job?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Good, it was very smooth and formal, interesting process. The person conducting the interview was respectable. Overall it went pretty well and we had a nice talk. It was all good, be prepared and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: Past experiences related questions I think

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions:
UBC is huge so interview experience will likely vary but it was fairly standard: 
- call for screening 
- group interview with team + usually one rep from central HR 
- mini project then presentation 
- then final interview with managing director
Interview Questions:
- tell me about yourself 
- why are you a good fit for the role 
- what about the role is interesting

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Multi-stage, we had to be selected initially from a background test and then we moved into a behavioural interview in person. The questions asked were pretty average, and I had no issue with answering all of them.
Interview Questions: Tell me  more about yourself?

title: Student Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is smooth and they ask basic questions that you can find by simply googling basic questions in interviews. They mostly have one round of interviews and may ask for references. It always helps if you ask questions to the interviewer on how to prepare for the same. I did that and basically I was told what to prepare for.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. Situational questions are also common.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Screening: HR uses Zoom to ask basic questions about the resume and discuss the next interview time. Technical: Three technical people were interviewed. One asks about work experience. One asks about Java, and the last one asks about SQL questions.
Interview Questions: Inner join and left join different

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Easy, ask some basic questions such as what is ur prior experience and how do you manage your time etc not too difficult and be prepared with the basic questions u can expect
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Online (due to pandemic) - panel review,  then a follow up meeting. Professional. Took a long time to get the interview, but overall a good experience. It took them a long time to finally let me know. Open to negotiating salary, but only up to a point.
Interview Questions:
Describe yourself in one word. 
Tell me about a time when your published work had a significant impact.

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
Cover letter + Resume + Application to fill out on UBC website. 

Very structured panel interview. Job specific related questions. You can't lie your way out of the interview. 

For experienced people, it should be a walk in the park. But if you're looking to get this job as your first legal assistant position, it may be very difficult.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would manage multiple lawyer's tasks?

title: Salesforce Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It had a lot of time taking take home assignments. Before tech screen I was given 2 methods of code and I had to improve them in efficiency, readability, scalability. It took me 7-8 hrs to correct code, list all improvements and prepare the file.
Then after clearing that round I was given another assignment to create a LWC for a university use case. I was asked to provide access to my code in SFDC prior to the interview.
In my tech interview I presented my solution and was asked very detailed questions around LWC around Javascript and CSS. They need expert level knowledge.
I was thrown away by the fact that they needed an expert in LWC but what I did in the solution carried no relevance. Kind of frustrating. I was not communicated that I had to be an expert in LWC to get the job, given there are so many other functionalities that make a SFDC developer.
Interview Questions: What does  javascript:void (0) do?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I was hired without an interview, as I believe there was a quick need for a sessional lecturer. The infrastructure for teaching is great, however the amount of bureaucracy is painful. I have not received keys after a month of working there.
Interview Questions: Will you take the job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Initial video call as part of two step interview process. Can only proceed to more formal interview if you get through this first call. More like a friendly chat. Friendly interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why you chose the job?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: In basket tasks are fairly old way of interviewing, there is a lack of diversity on many interview panels. Overall questions aren't unexpected but certainly feel like an interview process from the 1990s
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you disagreed with your supervisor how did you manage it?

title: Co-op Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Kelowna, BC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was done over Zoom meeting with two supervisors. I only had a one interview for the job. Prepare for behavioural questions and any portfolio/work that can showcase your skill .
Interview Questions: - Why do you want to work here? - What do you want to learn in this role? - How many work terms are you planning to do?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: No details provided about the position before or during the interview. Turned out to be a technical interview, which I was given no forewarning about, questions were randomly made up on the spot based on cherry picking technologies that I assume were connected to the project. Wasn't allowed to ask any questions before being dismissed from the Zoom session. One of the least professional interviews I've ever been in.
Interview Questions: How did you use JMS in this job from your resume

title: Continuous Improvement Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The AI video screening is time-limited in all questions. Get well prepared short answers for question supposes take a few minutes to give full answers. Practice the general questions that usually heard in first interviews.
Interview Questions: A history of education and professional background (2 mins)

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone email to fix a date for phone interview. And the phone Interview  is around 40min with some basic question about me and my background. And after first phone interview I got 2 phone interview with 2 persons. Some question about my professional experience and situation questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your professional expérience.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I got interviewed for BA positions twice by UBC.

First time around, it was via a recruiter:
- Initial interview with Recruiter.
- Scheduled interview with UBC Management Consultant. No one from UBC showed up. Me and the recruiter talked about the weather for 15 minutes.  Emailed UBC to see if they wanted to reschedule. They emailed back a week later to tell me they were held up by something. 
- Got ghosted after that.

2nd time:
- Got contacted by UBC HR to set up an initial interview
- Talked to 2 senior BAs
- Got ghosted again.

This was all within the last month. 

I'm currently putting this interview review in because I've since then twice been contacted by UBC for BA positions. Expecting I'll get ghosted again so I'm going to take their calls schedule interviews and then not show up. Screw em.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your experience with large scale enterprise level education ERP deployments.

title: Assistant MOA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: very good interview, hr was nice and made me feel calm. She was very gentle on asking questions, made sure I felt comfortable as well. Questions were given back and fourth, it was quite engaging.
Interview Questions: why were you interested in this job

title: Senior Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was overall a pleasant experience. They will arrange a time that works for both you and the interviewers. Upon entrance of the office, one of the interviewers invited me into a meeting room that fits around 7-8 people. The group of interviewers (a total of 3 people in mine) were respectful and friendly. They give you a comfortable atmosphere to introduce yourself and share your experiences.
Interview Questions:
1) Introduce yourself.
2) What makes you want to work for us?
3) What are your career plans in the near future?
4) Can you tell us an example in which you had conflict with another party (or imagine if you had one), and how did you dealt (or how would you have dealt) with the conflict?

title: Communication Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a mix of easy and challenging questions. They want you to have lots of experience and skills even for students. Since a lot of their projects are growing, the time commitment could be a lot.
Interview Questions: What can you offer to the team?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward with typical Leetcode coding questions (the ones I got were reversing a string, reversing a linked list, and merging two lists). A little bit of behavioral questions in the  beginning followed by the technical portion, which took quite a bit.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to the UBC community?

title: Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed by the supervisors, standard interview questions (tell me about yourself, why this position, past experience, behavioural & situational questions, etc.)
Pleasant conversation, really nice people, open to questions, nothing to be stressed about
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to balance different responsibilities and to-dos

title: Media Relations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Everything was on time and professional. The interview process was a panel and the panel was very inviting and welcoming. Questions were more behavioural-based and focused on the capabilities of the person.
Interview Questions: Name a time I had to handle conflict in the workplace and How did I dealt with it.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Hiring Solutions online interview consisted of testing as well as zoom call. Tests were timed and examined basic office skills and competencies. If passed, virtual call with a hiring manager to follow up on your resume. Not told of opportunities, just placed in an open position that might match your experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over zoom and very short, mostly character type questions and conversational in nature, not asking technical knowledge type questions. Felt like they were trying to get a feel for who I was as a person and how I would fit with their team.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work here?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow (PDF) Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview mainly focused on project related questions. Show your previous project experience. Behavior questions. Interview lasted for about one hour. Whole recruiting process takes about one week.  Friendly working environment.
Interview Questions: project related process control experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: interview, it was in-person. It took place in UBC in the instructor's office. I also had to do a demo teaching. The two instructors asked me bunch of questions including some scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have any teaching experience?

title: Technology Learning Rover Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was only one round and lasted 30 mins max. The questions are basic behavioural questions and some of that are related to the role (customer service, team work, etc.)
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple, but very boring, lacked questions/insight on job performed. The job was also removed from the website, giving no info on the full job description. The interviewers were polite, but did not give any indication that they wanted to be there
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for the job

title: Marketing officier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
- Screening call for 15 minutes
- Interview requested for the next week
- Asked to create a detailed communications plan (for one of their upcoming events) and to present it during the interview.
- Interview and presentation with four members.
Interview Questions: How would you design this campaign?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the PI (30 min) followed by an in person interview with two staff members (40 min) and finally a reference check. The interview had both behavioural type questions and questions specifically about my skills and experience.
Interview Questions: Your experience managing staff or co-op students

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: apply for the job online. Waited for a month to get the interview invitation, and the interview was lasting for an hour with three interviewers and waited two weeks to get the final result
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself, why do you want to work here, what are your shortcomings.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
Initial email screening, Technical interview in Data Science and Machine Learning, Take home test, Final offer
Initial email screening, Technical interview in Data Science and Machine Learning, Take home test, Final offer
Interview Questions: Q: How would you reduce overfitting problem

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process, prepare before heading towards the interview. Make sure you know where the location is beforehand as it can be difficult to navigate. Review all standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your lo term goals

title: Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview that is mostly focused on common behavioral and situational questions. It was conducted by a panel of interviewers remotely over zoom. The interview was scheduled to be around 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you think are the most important qualities for someone in such a role to have?

title: Adminstrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview. Felt like head of the department interview. I enjoyed it but recommend that prepare well. Interview was difficult and skills tested were more than an admin assistant would have to use.
Interview Questions: relate administrative skills to your experiences.

title: School Programs Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was an initial screening process that took about 15 minutes with one interviewer. Had the option of doing it over the phone or via zoom meeting. Was asked about 5 or 6 relatively quick questions.
Interview Questions: The questions were typical about why experiences, and how communicate with other organizations to maintain existing partner relationships.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Had to talk to the professor who teaches the subject I love. Questions were asked about my interest in the subject, my past experiences, and skill sets. Overall, it was a good interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a RA?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was all right. It seems that the interviewer decorated their projects and data to make them appealing to me. I think they have some leftover data that needs to be published.
Interview Questions: What do you choose us?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
3 phases,
Pre recorded interview
Word, Excel, Outlook and typing assessment
Zoom interview

Once you are hired to the roster you will wait to be notified of your assignment. It took about 2 weeks for me.
Interview Questions: Situational questions about dealing with students or faculty.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was recommended to UBC by a recruiter.

First interview: average, the panel asked relevant questions.

Second interview: terrible. The director kept bragging about his own achievement instead of talking about the organization, the project or ask relevant questions. Not only that, he kept bashing me about my skill and experience and how I'm not good enough for his team. AND..he asked me to stay extra 15 min to talk to me. Just to be polite, I said yes (I should have said no). He still kept talking about how great he is for this organization and the fact if he were to take me on, it would be huge risk.

Somehow I got the third interview...I decided to withdraw from the process. I told the recruiter UBC does not have what I was looking for.
Interview Questions:
- Scale 1 to 10, how would you rate your technical skill?
- In your opinion, where do you think you are in your career?
- What's your leadership style?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. The panelists took turns to ask me questions. The entire process lasted about an hour. Before beginning the interview questions,2 of the 3 panelists gave an overview of their organizations and the project they are working on.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your weaknesses

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
first they send you an email to confirm the interview time and date and the location and then they ask you to commute to UBC. on the day of interview they start the interview.  only one time interview with professors. 
after leaving the interview I saw another girl who  had a more open appearance (I had scarf covering my hair)  than myself who apparently waited for the same interview. when I finished the interview they never got back to me to say even a thank you for going to the UBC hospital with covid risks.
Interview Questions: what is your communication style like?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: First had to submit video responses to five questions. Then had an interview over zoom with a panel of three people. No HR team members involved in the interview on zoom.
Interview Questions: Question: Why you want to work at UBC.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy, straightforward, and nothing to worry about. If you score high enough in the course and have a recommendation then you should not worry about anything anything anything
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become TA

title: Lab Technician - Coop Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: At Ubc, they give you a tour of the labs and ask you a few basic questions. Nothing too extravagant or out of the ordinary. Overall easy interview and wouldn't be too nervous about it.
Interview Questions: What hand tools can you use?

title: Senior Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Short phone screening interview, followed by in-person interview with manager and one other staff member.  Both phone screening and interview were conducted professionally. Questions were relatively routine and predictable. No major surprises.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the position?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Few rounds of interviews. A lot of qualitative and behavioral questions that require you to think on the spot. Overall it is a simple interview and they just want to know if you are a good fit
Interview Questions: When is a time that you had to demonstrate leadership

title: Communications Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Phase 1: Phone interview (typical questions re: experience)
Phase 2: Video interview (They display a question and you have to record yourself answering the question - questions are situational)
Phase 3: Panel interview
Interview Questions: Tell us the difference between change management, communication and engagement.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online via the UBC student portal, and then I got the invite to do a video chat with 2 employees which was casual, and then was given the job offer
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you worked on a team

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Kelowna, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Interview questions were asked on zoom. The overall process was very chill. They mostly asked behavioral questions. I had to also submit application before hand stating why I wanted to work in said position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want be a web developer?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Had benefits from day 1, very good employer and lots of opportunities to apply for internal jobs after hire. I really enjoy the management style and workplace culture of this institution.
Interview Questions: What is your full name?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I had to interview with the language department head before being hired as a TA. The interview was fairly casual and was both in the language I was needing to teach and English.
Interview Questions: What previous courses have I taken in this language?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: You know have to go through a process of submitting a video recording of basic questions regarding the job. Then you're invited for an interview over Zoom because of COVID
Interview Questions:
What interests you about this job? 

What are your strengths/weakness?

Tell us about a time you dealt with a difficult employee.

title: Residence Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Friendly, lots of testing on how you can interact with people.

The team is nice. 

Questions are centered on interacting with other people 

You have both a group interview and also an in-person interview
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a conflict

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Well structured, easy, very comfortable. Conducted online. A one interview process with very clear expectation and guidelines. Was well prepared. Interview was approx one hour and was offered the job during the interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Ask the behavior questions and my previous experience and then give you some time to answer the question. Introduce yourself and your education period and give some examples. Most will be online interview and there will be some people there to ask you sevral questions.
Interview Questions: Why you want to apply for this job

title: Master of Engineering(Ece) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The application will be reviewed first. a minimum GPA required for further hiring steps.  Candidates are asked to discuss interests and targets in person with a coordinator in ECE program.
Interview Questions: Tell me a case when you chowed your leadership

title: Operations Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy to do but most likely you would get an interview through referrals. But once you get a referral, you are most likely guaranteed to work here.
Interview Questions: How do you communicate to a client when they are dealing with a problem in our facilities?

title: Senior Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview and  in basket test. Three managers interviewed me in about an hour and there was a 45 minutes in-basket test. The interviewers are very friendly. If you don't understand their questions, ask again and they will explain it to you.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the team

title: Content and Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Position was with UBC student communications dept. It was a panel interview with 5 participants and a short writing and editing test after the panel. This was one of the worst interview experiences I ever had over 10 year career. One panel member was extremely unprofessional, she kept yawning throughout the interview. The others were more polite but no one acknowledged the bad behavior.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to change your approach or plan.

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple step interview process. Starting with the first round of group interviews where you do different activities, and then followed by a second 1 on 1 interview if you make the cut.
Interview Questions: How would you handle X scenario?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, 2nd was designed to present findings of an findings from a challenging assignment, 24 hrs notice. Zoom, 3-5 person panel, friendly with a casual feel, but beneath the genuine niceties, definitely process-driven and serious
Interview Questions: After the getting to know you questions, they were interested in hearing me trace the development of my career to this position. How did I end up here?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very congenial process, with 3 levels  of panel interviews. The 2nd tier was tough, but it felt worthwhile. The Director attended the 3rd interview, however, and seemed to have slightly different thoughts about the role.
Interview Questions: How does int'l students' remote learning impact Canadian immigration?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed, slightly casual environment with the interviewer, asked situational questions to see what you would do, gave mini case-like scenario. Lots of opportunities for you to ask the interviewer about the job you are applying to.
Interview Questions: Tell us one thing about yourself that we can't find on your resume?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Group interview followed by personal interview , where groups went through 3 different steps each testing different aspects such as resource management, problem solving skills and behavior. The personal interview was based on your own individual experiences. It was very well planned and executed, and the feedback given was constructive and helpful.
Interview Questions: A really well thought of scenario question to understand how u make choices

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was an hour-long interview with two interviewers with standard behavioral questions asked. The interviewers were very friendly, and they took turns asking questions. Had some time to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about a time you had to juggle many different priorities

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: it was really good and people were welcoming and friendly. it was easy and not very challenging. would recommend to others. thanks. h m a  x x ee
Interview Questions: how are you today and how are you feeling?

title: Senior Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone "get to know you" conversation with eventual Supervisor & HR representative for about 15 minutes, then 45 minute Zoom panel interview with Supervisor, faculty member and staff director of associated department.
Interview Questions: What is the black diamond of executive education technology?

title: Work-Learn Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Applied through UBC Careers Online on the day term work-learn positions opened. Submitted a resume, CL, and transcript. Heard back a few days later, and was schedule to interview with a research group. Heard back that I got the position the same day.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our lab

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: This might have changed by now but it used to be faster to  just go to the nest and ask for a job in person than applying online. I never got any response through online applying but got hired right after when I talked to them in person
Interview Questions: What's your time table like?

title: Work Learn Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Laidback and very casual. A lot of questions were asked about previous experience, but they were not as necessary. The interview process was fun and it usually helps when you approach the professor and ask if they would like to hire a work learn student
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you are interested in this role

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Great hiring process. Had to submit a cover letter, Curriculum Vitae, work samples and. mention what experience I had teaching first-year grad students. Overall great process. And good response time too.
Interview Questions: What's your level of experience?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds that include technical skills learned from NLS and then this is followed by a dry interview with situational questions to answer. Overall make sure you’ve practiced your NLS skills and Teaching skills too as those are the focus for the test.
Interview Questions: A student complains about failing their lesson, the parent comes up to you angry what do you do?

title: WorkLearn Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview for 30 minutes. General behavioural & position-related questions. Got the interview offer the last week of August, which is very late for a WorkLearn interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about the time you had to work in a team

title: Web Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of describing my previous projects and my approach and steps of solving problems with my project. Along with a period where they asked some web development terms and I was tasked with giving definitions of the terms.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you can do to improve your project?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were two stages to the interviews, with each only involving questions (e.g. no tasks/presentations). In the first interview, I met people I would work with directly and in the second interview, I met executives that I would likely only report to on an ad-hoc basis. At the end of the second interview, they asked for references.
Interview Questions: What parts of the job description would be most challenging for you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
easy process
i talked with prof, asked for toefl score and asked for coding experience 
and previous publiocations , then applied on line and passed toefl exam , then received acceptance took one day
Interview Questions: what are your goals as a graduate student?

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews were conducted:
the first interview was with immediate supervisor which was longer
and a final interview with department chief which was shorter
The first interview started with self introductions
in both interviews, there was no indication how much time would be allocated for each question
all interviewers looked nice and approachable
Interview Questions:
All were very generic questions including:
why did you apply?
what challenges do you expect at this position?
What do you expect to achieve in 3-5 years?
Then followed by some situational questions such as conflict handling
at last up to the interviewee to raise questions about the office and university

title: Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a very smooth interview process, with very helpful managers and a great experience working for UBC for more than 2 years as a student. Can not recommend enough.
Interview Questions: My previous experiences and how the skills I gained there relate to the position I am interviewing for.

title: Waitress, Event Assistant, Hostess, Barista Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
It was great! They were caring and asked me questions that showed me that they wanted to learn more about me. 
It was a lot of behavioral questions and situational based as well, so really relate your experiences.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Discuss your pros and cons for this position and reactions to different students' scenarios. The reason why you are qualified for this position. And then ask any questions you may have.
Interview Questions: What would you do when you see a silent group?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, mostly based on your grades and course knowledge.  The interviewers are just professors and sometimes the job is totally based on grades.  Overall, a great experience and having a teaching assistant position on your resume is a huge upside
Interview Questions:
Do you have any previous teaching experience?
Did you like the course when you took it?

title: Graduate Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth with the people who would be supervising me. Good questions on what would I bring to the position, my abilities, my previous experience. It was a very inviting environment, I was encouraged to ask questions regarding the position at the end.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to this position? What would be my biggest struggle if I got it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was with the study coordinator and another with PI and co-workers, wanted to hear about my experience and clinical research practices. Had another call from HR to discuss salary and benefits.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your last position, research experience and why this job is a good match for you?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview included questions about my research experience and experience working with others. A panel interview with PI and other associates that would be working with. The interview aligned with the job description and a typical panel interview(s).
Interview Questions: How did you manage a difficult stakeholder?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview process of this job application. You can just apply for this position on UBC Mathematics website. with your math course grades, experience, and available time session
Interview Questions: There is no interview for this application.

title: Engineering Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly laid back with two professors via Zoom. They only asked about my previous experience and how that would relate to the position. No behavioural questions were asked just technical ones.
Interview Questions: Tell me about *this* experience on your resume

title: Learning Tech Rover Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, asked general as well as detailed questions. Was asked about previous experience and how i will be an asset to the faculty. I was also asked if i had previous experience working in customer service or any other jobs where i had to help people with technology.
Interview Questions: How would i tackle a situation where a faculty member feels stuck?

title: Co-Op Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy going. Many QA and situational questions to test how you are thinking on your feet. Mine was online due to covid, so in person interviews might be a bit different.
Interview Questions: How would you test a hand sanitizer dispenser?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
1. Friendly HR managers for interview process
2. Business casual clothing preferred
3. About an hour’s length
4. Situational and behavioural questions
5. Interpersonal and communication skills 
6. Strong reference helps
7. Background check
Interview Questions: Relevant knowledge/ experience to the job description

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
Apply if you can handle their process.
1. Apply online.
2. Record about 5 videos answering some questions they've asked to you and send.
3. Pass the MS suite (Excel, word, outlook ect..) and administrative skill test. 
4. In person interview, FINALLY!
5. Reference Check.
6. WAIT until there will be some departments need you.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for this position?

title: Center of Accessibility Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: First do a prescreening via phone call. Typical interview process and last for about 30 minutes, stary by introducing the scope of work to you followed by asking you some common interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for us? Describe your strength and weakness.

title: Business Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with a reference, got an email 2 weeks later asking to set up an interview in a couple of days. First interview was soft skills/scenario questions. After the interview they gave me a take home assignment that I had a couple of days to complete and present.
Interview Questions: How many shoes are sold in Vancouver in June?

title: Partner Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
4 panelists (3 from the same office including the reporting officer and 1 from a different office that works closely) 

1 hour- Interviewers took turns asking questions set on paper and wrote down notes on every response

30 mins test- tasks mirroring the daily job scope like writing emails to prospective partners and preparing summary report for senior management

Outcome given via email about a week later- very polite and sincerely written message
Interview Questions: What kind of work environment do you want to be in?

title: Assistant Educational Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come down to UBC without having a phone or skype interview first. The interview went well and they had me come down again to interview with the director who asked the same questions as they did the first time. Seems like it would have been more efficient if he just sat in the first interview. A few red flags that I noticed in terms of professionalism, and my references noticed as well. However, once I received the offer, they informed me that they could not pay me what the posted salary was, so I wasted many hours and a lot of effort interviewing for a job that had dishonest posting information. Waste of time and effort and got a better offer where they were able to honor the described salary.
Interview Questions: Many questions about higher education, educational technology, and how to support faculty

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good ,That might sound like hyperbole to those who haven’t been watching the geographical shifts among the tech world’s power centre. Sure, Silicon Valley still leads North America (if not the world) in venture capital committed, and it remains home to the world’s tallest tech giants and scores of talented immigrants
Interview Questions: The evidence has been piling up like January snow for a decade, even if some of us have been slow to notice. That evidence is now all around us and it’s impossible to ignore.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the UBC external employee postings. I got an email 2 weeks later by the research coordinator to be interviewed. The interview itself was 30-45 minutes in a conference room with the research coordinator, a graduate student, and another research assistant. The questions ranged from my past work as well as research experience related to my personal interests. In the end I was asked to write a 10 minute essay on a research related topic.
Interview Questions: What is your best research accomplishment?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite straightforward . The first interview was with 2 senior managers and was around the 1.5 hours. The second interview was more informal and with 2 other managers and took around 1 hour
Interview Questions: Mostly about how my past experiences and skills would apply to the role I was interviewing for. Also lots of behaviour questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: ask me some question about have you worked in lab. I did this as an volunteer. so it is kinda easy to work as unpaid. but it is a good experience
Interview Questions: have you worked in lab before?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online test then in person interview. Pivot tables and other stuff are tested in excel but you hardly use it in most of the positions. You might have a second chance to do it.
Interview Questions: What's your goal? Questions about your resume.

title: Human Resources Administrative Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied and they invited me to apply again through the Institution's website, once I did that they send me a Vidcruiter link where I needed to record myself answering 8 questions (all of them behavioural). Second filter was a face to face interview that took an hour and a half where they asked me about my experience very thoroughly. The third filter was 4 aptitude exams: Word, Excel, Outlook and typing and lastly a psychometric exam. After all of this they sent me a reference check for 5 people and 3 needed to be supervisors.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer and how did you solve it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was two hours long. The first hour was done on a laptop for you to answer some admin related questions. Then I was interview by three people together for another hour, mainly asking some situational questions and some brief questions about your abilities on Microsoft/Google, etc.
Interview Questions: Describe one time when you didn't/couldn't finish a task

title: Work Learn Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: conversational. the job listing had kept getting extended, so i figured they weren't getting applications. i took a shot, and applied online thru UBC's student job portal. i sent in my resume and a cover letter specifically written for the application. the interview was a one on one with the program director. she was very conversational, and allowed me space to explore my answers. she offered me a sheet with the questions she would ask, so i could take some quick notes before we began. they hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: How does colonialism continue to inform Canadian society?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Kelowna, BC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: A very informal interview process if you know the professor. Communication is kept mainly through email. If you show real interest in the research, getting the position is not difficult.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research?

title: Hiring Solutions Administrative Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I got an interview with UBC hiring solutions.
It has 1. Video interview 2. Skills Assessment 3. Face to face interview 4. Reference Check
It almost took 2 weeks, and it's very organized.
Interview Questions: Why you apply for this company?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Apply on an internal site and get an interview in person.  The interview process was very easy and straightforward.  Once you upload your resume took a couple of weeks for the interviewer to get back to you and then you get offered an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Purely based on credentials, resume and online form submission. Interviews were to ask about specific knowledge bases for best fit. The administrator conducts them herself and an assistant will help allocate resources to each individual class based on past experience.
Interview Questions: What specialty, or research are you currently conducting

title: Research and Evaluation Analyst Interview
