Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed with the Planning and Institutional Analysis Office (PAIR). It was a very long process that took over 2 months, while the hiring manager kept promising the decision will be made soon.
I applied online with my resume and cover letter. I heard back in 2 weeks that I am invited for a presentation interview in 2-3 weeks. I prepared a presentation about myself and past work and the interview went well. The reference check took a long time and I suspect that some references from my previous company gave a biased review about me or my other references. However, it was a small company and half of their staff left within a year due to company problems.

I was surprised that hiring managers did NOT check my transcripts from UBC and my internal references from UBC (previously worked with UBC Professors). I was further disappointed when I received a generic rejection email from “DO NOT REPLY” address. I was at least expecting a thoughtful rejection email after a few months of patiently following up with them. It’s difficult to believe that UBC does not value their graduates and does not treat candidates well during the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Discuss a large-scale survey project you recently ran from beginning to end. How did you manage the expectations of different stakeholder groups?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: After a short 1:1 Interview, there was a 90 min programming test. I was disappointed that the job description the interviewer told me was quite different from the one I applied for.
Interview Questions: Why UBC?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: SUPER unprofessional, slow, outdated... I was interviewed for Communications Coordinator in the Equity & Inclusion Dept. (applied in Jan and didn't get called til April...) The team here including the manager give very awkward vibes - although I felt the first interview went well on my part, I left with a strange feeling. They emailed me for a second Interview, so I went all the way there for another interview with some higher-ups. This one felt a bit better but still they were late and unorganized. Then they emailed me a few days later asking for references. Ok.. so they called both references, who said that the conversations went really well. Then I heard nothing for a week, so I followed up with an email. Nothing. They completely GHOSTED me.. and now it's been almost 2 months and still nothing. Extremely unprofessional, and rude. Especially after 2 in-person interviews, an assignment, reference checks, AND saying they would contact me. After seeing the office and the way I felt in the interviews, I am glad they never offered me the position because I feel like I dodged working in a shitshow environment!
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a disagreement with management and how you handled this.

title: Network Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: During the interview process I met with my main administrative boss and talked less technically first and then met with the person who became my direct report after about more technical stuff. I heard back a week later with an offer through my university's co-op website.
Interview Questions: What web technologies I was familiar with.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview is quite easy, basically you just need to introduce yourself, and then they will ask your skill sets and why do you want to join the research team. Besides, there are some background checking.
Interview Questions:
1. the image processing procedures
2. the coding skills

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor is nice. She asked about my projects and my know ledge about webGL. And she asked me some questions about how to deal with multitasks and time management.
Interview Questions: How do you do time management?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then after a few days,  received an e-mail telling me that I have been shortlisted, and asked me to choose from a list, the time slot that suites me for an interview. I went there and the interviewers were very professional and supportive.
Interview Questions: Why would you represent a potential candidate?

title: Student Information Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Extremely friendly and straight-forward. Don't wanna reveal too much information but the recruitment team is definitely responsible for their department as well as applicants, even I was not offered the job position finally. Learned a lot from them and got pretty positive feedback. Panel interview with some challenging questions followed by an in-basket test, and surprisingly got another phone interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had conflicts with your team member and how you solved the problem.

title: Civil Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was long distance phone interview. I was asked about my background and my masters' project. My PhD project was explained to me.  It was short interview. I don't remember more about the interview.
Interview Questions: What was your masters project about?

title: Residence Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: They mainly asked behavioral, situational based questions and had follow up questions that prompted a discussion. The interview process was around 45 mins and I received an offer the following week.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: I contacted many professors but most of them did not take graduate students. My interview was very quick and I did one phone interview and one 1:1 meeting with the supervisor and he asked me several questions and that was it.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in my research?

title: Summer Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Search post online
submit your resume and cover letter as well as transcript
Talk to the professor directly in person if possible
Talks about your past experience
talk about your interests and related courses
why you want to work for him
what's your plan in the future
Interview Questions: what's your interest area? why you want to work for me?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening or through Zoom virtual first. Sometimes, references be checked before any further action. face to face will be the final step and all group will show up and you may also get a tour of lab as well.
Interview Questions: Besides technical questions, the frequent question asked to you is what your goal in 5 years or if you have a plan go back to school, etc

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very interactive. The first stage is a group interview with some case scenario questions. The second stage is a one on one interview with more personal questions.  Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: The questions vary a lot but there are definitely some scenario questions.

title: Business Analyst Co-op Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: It was with a panel of two interviewers.  Most of the questions are based off on the resume and cover letter. There is a mix of behavioural questions and technical questions about the job. It was a relatively casual conversation.
Interview Questions: Elaborate on work experience on the resume

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy but require knowledge. I love the atmosphere here as a teaching assistant and I would do my job in short timelines. I love the job and I will try my best to do it.
Interview Questions: Is your time flexible?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief, personal, lots of personal background/experiences considered given the relationship I had with the supervisor. Called into office for a one on one discussion of logistics, qualities/research purposes, project options.
Interview Questions: Want to be a grad student?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
If you're looking to hire a Pharmacy Manager, Pharmacists, Registered Pharmacy Technician or Pharmacy Assistant, RPI can help you find the perfect candidate quickly and efficiently.

RPI's rigorous recruitment process ensures that your pharmacy will be in good hands. We can connect you with candidates who are injection-trained, able to dispense methadone, administer COVID-19 tests, smoking cessation certified and more. Contact us today and let us help you with your staffing needs.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not very difficult. I was asked about the projects that I worked on in university. Also, I was worked which area of research  I want to pursue in MSc.
Interview Questions: - previous research projects

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two step process with an oral interview of about one hour followed by a written test that was about the same length. The two were back to back so there was no time to reflect on the first stage before moving on to the second.
Interview Questions: Very odd experience interviewing with one department. It was a panel of 3 with many questions/follow up questions almost leading in a certain way.  One interviewee tried to ask about borderline personal information and reached out to a reference before the interview without informing me.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met one-on-one with the hiring professor in person. Was a very informal interview - my prior research was discussed along with my previous publications.   I had the opportunity to ask about research being conducted in the lab and to point out which projects I would be interested to work on.
Interview Questions: What are my research goals and aspirations

title: Academic Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to do a personal interview and a computer skill test afterward. Three interviewers met me at the same time. The questions are some general behavioral questions, and the computer test includes writing an email, data entry, and documents sorting.
Interview Questions: What do you think are good consumer services in general, and what do you think are good consumer services for this position?

title: Temp Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, send the recording of your interview questions.  After you pass the initial interview, then you are asked to come to the office for a PC test and an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Introduce your self, some behavioural questions etc

title: Senior Game Designer & Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied to their job posting and was called for an on-site interview date of my choice. It was one hour and mostly went through my resume, portfolio, asked about my goals, motivations, process as well as current work permit status.
Interview Questions: What is my approach towards leadership of a team of undergraduate students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The process is fast especially when they are interested in you. Interviewers contact you within two weeks of submitting your application.
Your interview will be booked based on your preference. It could either be a phone or in person interview depending on what is most convenient for you.  It is never stated if there is an advantage of one over the other but your preference is taken highly into consideration.
Interview Questions: What are some of the ways you've handled conflict in the past?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted about 4 weeks after applying. Only asked for an in person interview conducted by 1 MD. They didn't have very many questions for me and a bulk of our conversation happened when I started asking my own questions. Got an offer but the process of getting an offer letter has taken a while.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes long interview, with 2 people asking questions.  They were very friendly and the interview felt very comfortable. But make sure to prepare for all student leader experiences you've had previously.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you wish you would've done differently in your previous work experience?

title: Work Learn Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I called in for an hour interview after submitting online application. In the end, schedules didn't mesh, don't know why this wasn't outlined in the description.  The interviewer was nice, asked the standard questions of an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for a phd student position. It was a super friendly environment. I got questions for my past working experiences and research experiences. None of them were too difficult. They basically wanted to know what I had done and what I wanted to do for my upcoming phd research.
Interview Questions: What are the research topics that you are interested in?

title: Undergraduate Outreach and Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with Manager and Faculty member. During the interview, they both took turns asking questions and taking notes. No union member was present.  There was also a testing section in which a writing sample was collected as well as answering situational questions
Interview Questions:
In what order would you organize and plan an event?

Draft an email communication to an important guest who will be giving a lecture on campus.

title: Undergraduate Outreach and Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with Manager and Faculty member. During the interview, they both took turns asking questions and taking notes. No union member was present.  There was also a testing section in which a writing sample was collected as well as answering situational questions
Interview Questions:
In what order would you organize and plan an event?

Draft an email communication to an important guest who will be giving a lecture on campus.

title: Worklearn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was simple; applied on ubc careers online. you choose the job that you want and you submit to them your resume and cover letter. sometimes they want a writing sample. also you may need to have references.
Interview Questions: Asking mostly behavioural questions like what would this make you do, who are your most admirable people that you look up to, what are your strengths, what are your weaknesses.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: questions related to development, stewardship. what would you do if... how would you handle ____. Meeting with hiring manager and current employee in the same position. 1 phone interview, 2 in-person interviews
Interview Questions: A donor is not happy with the direction of the faculty despite making a large donation  last year. They want answers and accountability. What steps do you take?

title: Learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went through a lengthy panel interview. Was asked questions from multiple people who did not work in department. Did not hear back from employer immediately and I learned at a later date that the position was dissolved.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in 5 years?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of quick questions and it lasted 20 minutes. The hiring process was pretty easy because everyone was very nice and easy to talk to. Because it was a student environment, they are all understanding of the schedules so they have been very accomodation. There were 2 people in the room.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick, clean, and nothing surprising. Had taken the class and excelled in the coursework. The position had a few applicants and most were hired. Great experience, that I would recommend to anyone interested in forming a network within education!
Interview Questions: Your favorite course topic, what you would like to see changed/kept, what role do you believe a professor has in society

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is a fairly relaxing meeting. Senoir staff asks many technical questions. The interviews go in one hour. There are three people doing the interview. Prepare about the job description questions. Especially you need to be familiar with the project background.
Interview Questions: How can you work independently?

title: Intermediate Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online and had interview with 4 senior designers / art directors.  Very standard behaviour questions and asked a lot of past relevant experience and portfolio. They made me comfortable and show me around the office after the interview
Interview Questions: What's your design style? Walk me through your experience and portfolio

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Meet the PI, discuss projects and interests, work ethics, past experiences, test on knowledge using general questions and quiz. Meet the members of the PI labs, social activity such lunch.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in chemistry, how to you see your future

title: Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Be interviewed by two ladies in the meeting room of research finance. Asked several question about basic accounting question. The tricky part is the in basket test which include Excel stills, analysis and scenario analysis. The excel part was easy. For the analysis, I had no idea what the report they provided to me means. It was a internal report or analysis structure with no explanation, and they expect me to answer 10 questions. I totally failed.
Interview Questions: What is accruals?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 90 mins with a panel and included questions and behavioral questions and task.  The panel was thorough in their questioning. The interview would rate as being moderate to difficult.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position ?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The only interview was conducted by the lecturer themselves, candidates were shortlisted earlier by the department, or by their respective lecturers. It also depends on whether you know that professor or not, because they can request you as a TA, which allows you to avoid this process.
Interview Questions: Candidates might be asked a class- specific question, I was asked to talk about my involvement in the department.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a few days after the closing date, and asked to interview the next week. Interview was run by four employees, taking turns asking questions, and lasted approximately 90 minutes. Most questions were very specific, but all related to the skills and duties that would be required in the role. I found them to be very fair.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over all the other candidates?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview, containing both general interview questions and a mini case. Overall it was a positive interview experience, all the questions are fair. The mini case was really interesting.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Asian Library Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asking questions about my resume, like my previous job and how I think I'm a good fit for this job. Then tell me some requirement about this job and ask me if I can handle different situations during work. This is intended to test if I read their job description carefully
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a careful and detail-oriented person?

title: PhD Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the prof 4 times without any responses! Got contacted by the prof after the 5th email! It mostly depends on if the prof has funding to hire grad students! If you think you are a good match keep emailing. or maybe call the prof.
Interview Questions: Some background questions based on my resume.

title: IT Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: got a email from manager to arrange a in person interview at office of UBC. Met with IT manager and project manager for half an meeting interviewing more about project management and cooperation.
Interview Questions: how many  years project management experience do you have?

title: Human Resources Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a video interview on an online platform - a bit intimidating at first, but really not too bad. After the video interview was reviewed, I had a quick phone meeting with a member of the recruiting team to set an appointment for a live interview. The interview was with the Manager and Recruitment Manager, followed by a meeting with key stakeholders in the portfolio assigned to the role.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had to work with a difficult stakeholder. How did you work together? What was the outcome?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in person after a scrrening of my CV, but a skype interview it was also possible. They asked me to talk about my previous research experience and my future idea. I present my work to the group.
Interview Questions: They asked me to present my job to the research group 3 days before

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone screening interview, followed by in person interview. Mostly behavioral interview questions. Most questions were fairly generic and there was an HR manager as well as HR coordinator who was leaving.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance where you had to interview a position that is higher than you. What questions have you asked?

title: Student Info Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was a panel interview with the school director, administrator, and 3 chairperson. About 9 questions were asked and I felt unprepared for all questions, probably because it was my first interview with such a big university.

Each person asked about one to two questions. Most of the questions are behavioural questions. The school administrator was in charge of HR and therefore questions from that person were more challenging.

Questions were both practical and behavioural.
Interview Questions: What would you do to keep work confidentiality if you are working in an environment that is not private?

title: Hiring Solutions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application Form,  Basic Video Interview then software testing followed by the pretty easy interview. Software testing included MS outlook, excel and word along with some customer service test. Video Interview included similar questions to the normal interview and included seven questions
Interview Questions: Basic questions on CV

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is based on your documents during your application. Each department has their own admission group to evaluate the applications. While your applications is being evaluated they take a look at your GPA from your previous academic institution, academic experience, work experience, your ability to do your research (based on your journals or conference papers), recommendation letters and your statement of purpose letter.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research motivations and your academic goals in the future.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. contact the PI with your resume
2. they might give you some paper to read and you need to write a research review
3. face to face interview (with presentation)
4. interview with other lab members
Interview Questions:
1. Why you want to join us?
2. What is your previous experience?
3. How do you do problem solving. Give example.
4. How much do you know about proteomics?
5. What is your career goal?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I walked into a room with the interviewer, who turned out to be my supervisor and the one I addressed the cover letter to. All questions related directly to the job, in addition to some typical human resources questions. A few questions also related to technical things about the specific group within UBC, but nothing 15 minutes of research wouldn't tell you.
Interview Questions: What do you think could be improved about <this aspect of UBC>?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Supervisor conducts a Skype interview. If the PI is satisfied with the interview and one's credentials, he will make an offer. Then you can enroll as a PhD student and work in his research group.
Interview Questions: Basic technical questions in electrical engineering. Questions about research experiences.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two in-person meetings along with a 24 hr request for a portfolio which made no sense. Interviews were fine, however after doing 2-3 it took them 3 months to follow-up with a final response despite my asking for follow-up twice. Wouldn't interview there again.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and a pre-screening. Sent me an email requesting a phone time  for a few quick questions for a short-list process. Asked me why at this point I'm applying for the job and asked me how I would qualify for this job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you would qualify for this job

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour interview, was long, easy, simple, didn't get to meeting every hiring person, still calm and no too intimidating at all, had to plan what a day in life as a tour guide would be in vancouver
Interview Questions: N/A

title: User Experience Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions:
One interview over the phone
One interview in person to go over my experience
One interview to show portfolio and technical assessment.

They tried to involve different people in each of the interviews.
Interview Questions: tell me a situation where you had to design something you felt didn't solve the problem?

title: Occupational and Research Safety Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions:
Was asked to prepare a short presentation on safety topic of their choosing (safety culture). I only had two days to prepare the presentation
After giving presentation to panel of 3 individuals, two managers and the persons who's role i'd be taking over, a traditional interview followed. Both technical and situational questions were asked. Entire interview lasted an hour.
Interview Questions:
What are the differences between WHMIS and the new GHS system?
Describe the hierarchy of controls for fall protection. 
Are their any type of people you just can't work with?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was approximately one hour in length and there were 4 individuals evaluating me. Mostly classic behavioural questions required you give an example when you were in a specific situation and the reaction you took and what the outcome was. Along with some technical questions. Also discussed job conditions and general requirements
Interview Questions: Give me an example of you handled difficult individuals?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed by the unit asking me to come in for an interview. I came in for an hour long interview, and was offered the job later in the week. I accepted on the same day, and started three weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about marketing tools you've used.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were four interviewers - 1 HR, 2 Managers, 1 Director. That was a bit daunting but they were all nice. There was one interview before I got the job and then they checked my references.
Interview Questions: Experience with CCDC contracts and how is it implemented?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to UBC website. Long wait time, had the interview request after several weeks. The interview was a panel discussion that lasted about 45 minutes. Asked much of the common expected questions. The interviewers were very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was fair. it did not get much time. the employer asked some questions regarding the researches that I had previously done. I described my interests and what I am mostly inspired of. then he asked some question about my other experiences such as my internship. I descsribed my work during the summer in one of the companies that I had previously attend. the employer acts really friendly and I was really comfortable during the meeting.
Interview Questions: research

title: Worklearn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: very typical as you would expect, not that formal, but interviews are usually done with 2 people. they will ask you whether or not you know anything about the department or whatever position you're applying for (the goals and values). so research is needed.
Interview Questions: the typical why do you want this job? and bunch of behavioural questions and what ifs. also asked about your faults and if you ever messed up, etc

title: Probation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: This is a 2 year process , employees are initially hired based on a contractual term.  Work is not guaranteed yet it takes many interviews, essays, presentations .  This is done in front of 3 managers and it takes about a month to hear back on whether you passed the interview or not and then they will call you when a position is available.
Interview Questions: Competency based questions

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: i had a really super casual discussion with mentor and they liked me i guess becuase they hired me and i've been here for around one to four years .
Interview Questions: what are you interested in studying?

title: Residence Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application, and then considered applicants will get an email regarding a sign up for an interview slot for the carousel process (a unique experience but definitely learned a lot). The interview is usually 2 on 1, so it may seem overwhelming but don't worry too much.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were assertive.

title: Narrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: First, one is called for a test audio recording . One is  hired according to recording' quality. There are no interview questions, except when one is able to start and if they are entitled to work in Canada..
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online then they contact you to answer a series of behavioural question scenarios through video responses.  At which point they tell you they will be in contact if you go through to the next step which is face to face interview and computer testing.  Basically it's like a short term contract staffing agency for ubc dept.  staff is nice but they seem to have turnover there too.
Interview Questions:
What would you do
If you feel like an employee needs more training?

title: Vice President IRSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds: First an online form, followed by a skype call and then an in person interview. First two rounds are easy, in person interview questions get you thinking on your feet.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for us? What can you bring to the table?
Why should we hire you?

title: Senior Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process changes every year. Consists of the general interview for all RAs followed by the Senior Advisor Interview. If you are a returner to Residence Life, you won't get any surprises.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were in conflict with a supervisor.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Approach your prof at the end of the semester and tell him how you have enjoyed the course and you need a work experience. Then, he will send you a list of required documents to submit. Also, you will hear from the department regarding the SIN and study permit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Co-Op Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via Co-op, notified of interview through Co-op Coordinators & set up time through them. Interviewed at VGH and there were two interviewers. They took turns asking questions, both were really nice and genuinely wanted to get to know me
Interview Questions: Describe past work experiences/ what you did

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Applied posting as advertised on university's job site, received an email shortly after (probably because the position was to start quite soon). It was for a position I was already trained in so it was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: How do you approach solving a new problem

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer is the research mentor himself. He wants you to talk about your previous research experiences and how you expect to learn from this job and what do you want to do to prepare for this position. Previous research experience is. A huge plus comparing with your competitors no matter how good their grades are
Interview Questions: Mostly talk about your experience/ introduce your self type questions

title: RA In UBC Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process depends on your supervisor. In cases maybe an interview and in cases not. Generally, you need good GPA from a recognized university, some papers in prestigious conferences and journals, and a language proficiency certificate. If the supervisor wants to have an interview with you it may be telephone interview, a short exam, etc.
Interview Questions: What papers have you published? In what journals/conferences?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Just need to submit application including CV and Cover letter online. The HR will allocate the job offer. It is very easy although most of the time the need heavily depends on the courses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy breezy interview, took a total of 15 minutes! Interviewer was really nice and approachable, not intimidating at all. Office environment you take an interview in is a conference room, bright and nice
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Stores Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: seems ok, could have gone better if was ore prepared, next time i will read more about job title, dunno why we have to write 50 lines/words when there is nothing more to tell, interview was pretty standard
Interview Questions: experience

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Went in once with a panel of interviewers. Asked a series of question about my myself, skills, and experience. Lasted for about 30 minutes. One upper management and 2 managers.
Interview Questions: What were your strengths and weaknesses

title: Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: just one round of interview with recruiter company and one to one in person interview with same recruiter, did not give any interview with ubc.. and after that 4 days later i got offer for job
Interview Questions: basic questions related to troubleshooting hardware, software

title: COOP Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: There will be multiple rounds. First round will be simple behavioral interview. Focus is more on team and problem solving. Previous experience is critical, particularly if you have worked in academic setting. Past experience working with students is beneficial. Questions will focus on commitment and problem solving. After this there will be a in-basket test which could be a presentation skills test to the co-op team.
Interview Questions: Team: tell me about your experience working in a team.

title: Course Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called to go to a live interview at Robson square campus. I was interviewed by two persons in charge of the multimedia department. They asked me different questions about  my previous experience, skills and what solutions would I propose on different troubleshooting situations
Interview Questions: about my previous experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a call asking for availability for in-person interview and scheduled it over the phone. Interview was less than a week later with 3 people interviewing me. All 3 interviewers were very clear and polite. Had questions prepared that seemed to be provided by resume or off internet. Some were a bit repetitive.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have with producing researching and writing for longer documents?

title: MASc In Mechanical Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my online application, my supervisor emailed me to talk about the project. He introduced the project and wanted to know if I was interested. After making my decision a few days later, I  contacted him. The official acceptance letter came few weeks later.
Interview Questions: Questions were directed towards my projects in undergraduate studies, and regarding my interest towards the new research topic.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview required for master's and PhD students. The student is required to  find a supervisor based on their research interest.  The faculty usually explains the research need to the interested student.
Interview Questions: No specific interview questions. The only time requirement was to narrow down the research interest for myself and finding the right faculty who would take you as a research assistant. By weekly meetings were held to monitor progress on research.

title: Program Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview required the preparation of a presentation where the topic was provided ahead of time. It was a panel interview involving individuals from different departments. The questions were difficult and more research on the candidate's side was needed.
Interview Questions: Name one strength and one weakness from the perspective of your supervisor. Name one strength and one weakness from the perspective of a student/subordinate.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied, it was a smooth process and called timely for an interview. Interview questions were fairly standard. I enjoyed the process and everyone was very polite. The interview was very good.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging workplace situation and how you resolved it?

title: Guest Service Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Kelowna, BC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three employees take turns asking questions. They were all very positive and enthusiastic to get to know you. Very comfortable atmosphere. The questions were mostly behavioral questions and asked you to describe your experiences and examples of your skills in detail.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a conflict with a guest, what was the situation, how did you handle it, and what was the result?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple, questions on teamwork and situation decisions. Interviewer seemed quite busy and started a little late. There were some more questions on previous experience and references. Two people were present but for only one interview round. Little technical questions but was asked about personal interests. Not very long, only around 30 minutes and also felt very short when compared to past interviews.
Interview Questions: What kind of teamwork experience have you previously had?

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: No in person interview. The question is all asked through an online survey.. The question are personality, experience, and achievement based. You should expect a week to carefully think of the answers.
Interview Questions: The question is all asked through an online survey.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Email to few supervisors, received from two. Meet them personally. The first meeting was just to say hello. Then another one with potential scope of work. Not really difficult to answer since it is in my own field. After few week everything was set up. then start working.

Easy job because I have prior experience in the field.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous research.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: No interview was required. I was hired by my PhD supervisor who had known me for 6 years already. He initially had admitted me in his research group based on my bachelor degrees for a masters program. I also did my PhD with him.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first received an email to set up a phone interview. They were very accommodating and flexible and even asked me to suggest a couple of times that would best suit me. I found the interview a bit tough over the phone because there were two people asking questions and I'm much more comfortable face to face. They asked the usual icebreaker 'Tell me about yourself' and other fairly straightforward screening questions. The second interview included doing a writing 'test'.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Residence Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The application opens in late December/ beginning of January, and interviews happen at the end of January- February, and acceptances early march. Interview consisted of groups of 10, we had a group interview which consisted of several stations. One station to build a puzzle as a team and an event planning station.
Interview Questions: Building a puzzle and being asked what you could have done better

title: Sales Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call for the interview next day. I had a interview for 10 mins. The process was very very quick and easy. They did a reference check at the same day of the interview day.  Had to do a could of paperwork online and I could work few weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be the best person for the job?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a 2-person panel and was fairly relaxed. No questions were surprising. If you prepare for the standard questions, it should be a breeze. The quality of experience for the students are the priority of the university so keep that idea in the back of your head while drafting answers. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you executed an communications campaign

title: Volunteer Museum Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the museum website (they only accept high school students). The HR manager at the museum sat me down and asked me some general questions about my past experiences and passion for biodiversity. It lasted about 30 minutes. Then candidates had to do some simple biodiversity activities such as identifying different kinds of flowering plants and animals.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: The positions are advertized and requires 3 years of post doctoral experience. Once selected for the interview by the principal investigator, the candidate would usually require to give a research seminar followed by personal interview with the PI and the lab members.
Interview Questions: Research direction, future path

title: Work Learn Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through Career Services for quite a few work learn positions before summer hit. Positions I applied for did not have any phone screening process (all positions within IT). 2 of them were simple 1-on-1 interviews with the direct supervisor. One of them had two interviews, with the first being for fit and the second being a deeper dive into your experience. All interviews were around 20-30 mins in length.

I was surprised that all three interviews were not at all structured as a typical corporate interview. It was an incredibly open-ended. There were of course the general questions at the beginning but it always led to them asking you to select something from your resume and doing a deeper dive into why you did it, what you got out of it, what you contributed and why it's relevant; be prepared for that.
Interview Questions: No questions were particularly difficult, most questions were quite easy to answer as long as you have prepared meaningful points on the experiences you have listed on your resume.

title: Special Projects Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initially I applied for a different position within the University and was referred to this position as it would be a better fit for my experiences and skills. Was contacted by the manager and asked to come in for an informational interview (guessing that my previous 2 interviews with the other position was seen as a good initial screening). After the information interview, was contacted by email two days later to schedule a second interview with inbasket testing. The second interview felt very relaxed and the team members that interviewed me were very easy to talk to and I felt very comfortable.
Interview Questions: There were no exceptionally difficult questions here. I always have difficulty with the "tell me about yourself" question but I seemed to impress them with my answer.

title: Work Learn Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Individual and group interviews. The individual had standard questions seen in interviews while the group interview was more activity based to see how you interact with peers in a group environment. The process was very quick and many different jobs all had interviews at the same time so you were not necessarily with people who were applying for the same job.
Interview Questions:
What are your greatest strengths & weaknesses ? 
Give an example of a time you displayed leadership?

title: Records Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a very lengthy process with four people in the interview room and whole lot of complicated and long questions. The interview is difficult but I learnt later that it's university policy to ask these long winded questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for the job? The questions were so long I can even remember

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: An email was sent out to us students within the department for the job opportunity. Once I sent my resume I was contacted the same day for a Skype interview. This was during the summer, so the professor was not in the country. The next day, I was hired.
Interview Questions: The normal questions: what makes you fit for this job out of all the other applicants?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the UBC HR site.  Was contacted quite quickly after the posting closed by the PI, who scheduled an interview the following week.  The interview was pretty casual - we mostly chatted about his research and my work experience, and he asked me why I was interested in working in his lab.  (Some PIs do ask more traditional interview questions, but I find that most of them prefer to talk about research.)
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: No phone interview, just email contacts between me and the professor. Discussed a few things about thesis and current work. Also talked about the future plan after graduation. I think it depends on which professor's group you are applying. Some may just take a look at your CV and publication. Some may give a phone interview.
Interview Questions: What is the salary expectation. It is difficult for a student to decide since we are also doing our study when working as a research assistant.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online application system. Application included cover letter and curriculum vitae. The University contacted me to schedule an in-person interview. I was away and they were very accommodating in agreeing to schedule Skype interview. I was provided materials about the position and the laboratory work in advance of the interview. Completed Skype interview. The interview was structured but the panel of two were very friendly and put me at ease. I was given the opportunity to ask questions. I was subsequently invited to attend in-person interview. I attended in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this role?

title: Operations Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Came in to interview for the position of Operations Staff within one of the facilities. The interview was conducted in an office by two individuals. The location was not hard to find and the instructions were relatively clear. I advanced to the second stage of interviews and was considered for the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had a difficult experience, and what did you do in that situation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Applied with undergraduate academic transcript, resume and personal statement. Sent email to supervisor after I submitted the application to the ECE department of UBC. Then I received email from a professor, he decided to give me an offer, I accepted it!
Interview Questions: Not asked a question

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: professional, good structure, offer to provide information about experience, skills and qualifications, department representation and human resources, questions about work related pressures and on the job performance, future plans and goals, former employer, experience
Interview Questions: Knowledge testing

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty much just a background check. They take your word for what you can do and then you start working in the lab for a while. If you are liked you're in.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: work as a student assistant, then become a part-time worker, then become a full time worker.
Interview Questions: how can I help to computerize the database.....

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: They invited me to an interview in the UBC Woodward library. They asked me about my education background and my interests. They also asked me about my experience when I had conflict with people and how I solved them.
Interview Questions: introduce yourself

title: Support Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Two to three person panel asking situational based questions revolving around how you handled stressful situations/people.
Had to write out an email that would go out to thousands of users informing them of an upcoming change. Needed to be professional, to the point and provide contact details for follow up questions regarding the change.
Interview Questions: What was the most stressful thing you had to do for a client?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I talked to my supervisor over the phone. That was a great experience. He gave me a time for a talk over phone. We had a chat about my past experience and possible future directions.
Interview Questions: What you have done in past?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly straightforward. Most of the questions were related with my research experience and their applicability to the job I was applying. I visited the lab and met with all the people working there. The purpose of this exercise to was to see if the candidate is going to fit in the lab culture.
Interview Questions: What are the values you can bring to the research team?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the professor I wanted to work for. After they recieved my resume and letters of reference we had a skype interview. After the interview I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: We mainly hire chemists, with your background in biochemistry how are you going to be an asset to the chemistry department here?

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 1/2 hour interview with 3 panel interviewer ask 5question each. Behavioural based questions. For example, describe the time when you have a conflict with your supervisor and how to resolve this conflict.
Interview Questions: No specific question was difficult. But there was a numerical reading test and basic counting knowledge question with in-house excel files

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Apply online.  Wait for an email from administration.
Interview Questions: Your grades.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: During the hiring process, I first applied to the position through the UBC career website. About a week later I heard from my now supervisor inviting me to come in for an interview. The interview was friendly and my supervisor is very nice, knowledgable and punctual. The interview included a description of the project I would be working on, and invited me to explain how I saw a fit. Only a few hours later my supervisor informed me that I had an offer.
Interview Questions: I don't know if I could say there was a difficult question. I am very qualified for the position so all the questions flowed quite well.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job and submitted a CV, but the whole process was based on the recommendation of a prof. This happened in the UBC Faculty of Medicine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions:
Process included an initial interview with various members of the lab and a subsequent second interview with the PI and Lab Manager. 
The first interview was mainly focused on technical experience, while the second was more of a personality screening exercise.
Interview Questions: In the past, describe a time that you made a critical mistake and how do you deal with mistakes that you make at the workplace?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was positive.  The interview was a panel format, and it did not appear that the interviewers were very well prepared in terms of either describing the requirements of the position, nor having made anything more than a cursory review of my resume.
Interview Questions: The most unexpected question was what a comprehensive business plan might include.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: a lot of questions about everything ranging from how the internet works to what you should do when your boss asks for something impossible
Interview Questions: How the internet works

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an initial phone call screening followed with an immediate request for an interview,. After the initial interview, there was an approximate 10 day wait, then I received another phone call asking me to come in for a second interview with my potential boss. This wasn't so much of an interview as a fact finding mission for both of us to see if we would be compatible. The final phone call offering me the position arrived about 2 days after.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, just be prepared, there were 2 people on the panel and they used a behavioral-based interview.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my CV to the group manager, received an email to schedule a telephone interview (I was in another country), 20 mins of telephone interview with two profs, some technical and some HR based question. Received an offer after about a week.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Course Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Talked to my would be immediate supervisor and the program coordinator at the same time. I described my personal experience with the subjects that Continuing Studies cover, specifically regarding my ability to solve questions that may derive from the software being taught.  Answered very specific questions regarding several scenarios when dealing with the students.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with someone that becomes frustrated and/or aggressive in the middle of the class?

title: Host Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had spoken with the regristrar's office inquiring about student oppurtunitties. They said every student services building offers part time employment to registered students at a maximum of 20 hours of work with a pay that is twice the minimum wage and referred me to the First Nations House of Learning- an aboriginals home away from home. I am happy to say the Manager is very fair, respectful and accommodated my school schedule.
Interview Questions: what Nation am I from?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
It was a straight forward process. This position was part of the co-op program for the university so it might have been simpler than the usual hiring process at UBC. 

I was asked how my education experiences tied to the position as well as how my future interests and dreams and desires were tied to the position.
Interview Questions: 1) How is this position tied to your future goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was for a summer research assistantship at a laboratory. There were two interviewers (research associate and research coordinator) who conducted the interview. I was a full-time student at the time, and they asked general interview questions related to my research experience, school and community involvement, and academic life. The hiring managers called my references by phone after the interview. It took them quite awhile to make a decision - about three weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experience in research.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had to prepare a 5-minute presentation on a topic of their choosing. There were two directors present at the interview, who asked a variety of questions: some about personality (generally as well as analytic vs creative), a variety of past experience questions (how I dealt with certain situations), a few scenario-based (how I would deal with certain situations), and one or two questions to assess creativity and outside the box thinking.
Interview Questions: List five alternative uses for a brick

title: Senior Invigilator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: there is no interview or standardized hiring process.  The coordinator makes a judgement, sometimes in consultation with other senior invigilators, as to who should be promoted from the regular invigilator staff.  There are no criteria specified.  Invigilators are not asked. There are no performance reviews.  It is a very haphazard situation.
Interview Questions: There were no questions

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was basically chat with the professor about experience and some basic knowledge test. Some basic questions on Java and Web knowledge. The interview is informal and fairly easy. The programming questions are basic (design patterns, etc.)
Interview Questions: Describe Spring Framework and the benefits.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC)
Interview Descriptions: Most positions at the University of British Columbia are union positions and, as such, priority is given to individuals who already work at UBC. Once they have gone through any internal applications, they will start considering external applicants. They will do an in person interview, usually with a small panel of interviewers from the department that posted the job ad.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Project Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Contacted through university website, got an email saying they'd like to talk to me. Interview was one on one, with 2 of their employees. One was their lab manager at the time, the other one was working on a project at that lab. Had a quick conversation about how I like to get work done, how I organize everything, how am I with deadlines. Overall, very nice and fair interview.
Interview Questions: There was a question on calculating concentration of something, but units were not known to me, so I couldn't convert. But it wasn't a big deal to them, I just explained the logic and my understanding of the question.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of British Columbia
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of a one-on-one interview with the professor for around 30 minutes. Asked about relevant experience and expectations of the job.
Interview Questions: Please go over all your research experience.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I actually did not apply for this role directly through some formal process. I just spoke to my professor after class if he had any available positions that I could fill in for him. He was happy with my performance in class and offered me a part-time position on the spot.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of British Columbia (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview followed by an hour long test.
